function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased reliance on remote work and telehealth leads to higher risk of contagious disease propagation through increased interaction in the built environment.","Impact":"Unmitigated spread of contagious diseases, leading to potential outbreaks and public health crises.","Mitigation":"Implementation of strict hygiene protocols, social distancing measures, and air quality improvement in built environments.","Technologies":"IoT for monitoring and control of air quality, contactless technologies for transactions, and remote work technologies.","People":"General population, office workers, healthcare workers, students, and other individuals participating in remote work and telehealth.","Owner":"Organizations, public health authorities, building managers, and individuals."},{"Description":"Increased reliance on technology for essential social interactions may lead to decreased in-person social connections, which can impact mental health and well-being.","Impact":"Isolation, loneliness, and mental health issues due to lack of in-person social interactions.","Mitigation":"Promotion of virtual social events, online support groups, and mental health resources, as well as encouragement of safe in-person gatherings where possible.","Technologies":"Virtual event platforms, online community forums, mental health apps, and social connection apps.","People":"General population, individuals who rely on social interactions for mental well-being, and vulnerable populations such as the elderly.","Owner":"Community organizations, mental health professionals, and individuals."},{"Description":"Shift towards technology-driven future may lead to increased cyber security risks and vulnerabilities, especially with the collection and sharing of personal and sensitive data for remote transactions and interactions.","Impact":"Data breaches, identity theft, and privacy violations, leading to financial loss and personal harm.","Mitigation":"Implementation of strong cyber security measures, encryption protocols, and data protection regulations, along with user education on safe online practices.","Technologies":"Secure communication platforms, encryption tools, two-factor authentication, and data privacy management systems.","People":"General population, individuals engaging in remote transactions and interactions, and organizations collecting and storing personal data.","Owner":"Technology companies, regulatory bodies, and individuals."}]}
